headline: Verizon Names a New CEO and the Stock Drops. AT&T and T-Mobile Are Falling Too.
summary: Verizon Communications  said  it was appointing lead independent director Daniel Schulman as its new CEO, changing its leadership as it tries to stop customers from switching to its rivals.  Verizon said that Schulman, the former CEO of  PayPal  would succeed Hans Vestberg, effective immediately.  Vestberg will serve as a special advisor until Oct. 4, 2026, to help support a smooth transition.

headline: Verizon names former PayPal boss Dan Schulman as CEO
summary: (Reuters) -Verizon Communications on Monday named former PayPal boss Dan Schulman as its new chief executive officer, replacing Hans Vestberg in a leadership transition aimed at steering the telecom giant through slowing growth in the wireless market.  The move comes as Verizon is battling rising competition against the backdrop of slowing subscriber growth and cautious consumers unwilling to buy premium plans offered by wireless carriers.

raw.headline: Verizon names former PayPal boss Dan Schulman as CEO

The move comes as Verizon is battling rising competition against the backdrop of slowing subscriber growth and cautious consumers unwilling to buy premium plans offered by wireless carriers.

headline: Verizon Taps PayPal's Schulman as New CEO
summary: Verizon shakes up the C-suite Dan Schulman, the longtime PayPal chief, is stepping in as CEO effective immediately, replacing Hans Vestberg. It's a surprise move tied to Verizon's integration with Frontier Communications. Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Telecoms Analyst John Butler joined Bloomberg Open Interest to break down what this leadership switch means for the company's turnaround.

raw.headline: Verizon Taps PayPal's Schulman as New CEO
raw.summary: Verizon shakes up the C-suite Dan Schulman, the longtime PayPal chief, is stepping in as CEO effective immediately, replacing Hans Vestberg. It's a surprise move tied to Verizon's integration with Frontier Communications. Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Telecoms Analyst John Butler joined Bloomberg Open Interest to break down what this leadership switch means for the company's turnaround.

headline: Verizon names board member and former PayPal CEO Schulman to its top post
summary: Verizon Communications is tapping the former CEO of PayPal to its top role, taking over the post from Hans Vestberg.  Dan Schulman, who has served as a Verizon board member since 2018 and is its lead independent director, will become CEO of the New York company immediately.  Vestberg will serve as a special adviser through Oct. 4, 2026.

headline: Digital Payment Update - Japan's Cashless Shift: Market Growth and Opportunities
summary: The Japanese digital payment market is set for significant expansion, projected to grow from US$ 469.54 billion in 2024 to US$ 1.32 trillion by 2033, driven by key factors such as increased smartphone penetration, a strong push towards a cashless society by the government, and advancements in payment technologies. The surge in e-commerce also contributes to this growth, although challenges such as cultural preferences for cash and cybersecurity concerns remain. As Japan endeavors to build a...

headline: NiCE Customers Lead the Way in CX AI Adoption, Redefining Customer and Employee Experiences
summary: HOBOKEN, N.J., October 06, 2025--NiCE (Nasdaq: NICE) today announced a series of tangible customer successes powered by its industry-leading CX AI. Organizations around the world are adopting CX AI to reduce wait times, improve service quality, cut costs, and equip frontline teams to deliver faster answers, more seamless interactions, and better customer experiences.
